channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: How decades-long ticket scam cost Paris’ Louvre more than Rs 100 crore
Why did the US envoy visit India’s army command near Pakistan?
Who was Robert Dorgan, who shot his ex-wife and kids during a hockey game in Rhode Island?
‘When dragons ate the Sun’: The superstitions around a solar eclipse
China’s nuclear build-up near Arunachal: How worried should India be?
AI in farming: What is Bharat-Vistaar, multiligual tool for farmers?
Bangladesh: Tarique Rahman’s win is a rejection of Yunus’s Islamist vision
item.description: If the Tarique Rahman government governs inclusively, resists ideological extremism, and balances regional relationships wisely, February 12 may be remembered as the moment Bangladesh reasserted not only its democratic voice but also its strategic self-respect

item.title: Failed marshal, unfailing crisis: How long can Pakistan endure?
item.description: While Pakistan goes through crisis after crisis, ‘failed marshal’ Asim Munir is travelling the globe acting as the finance, foreign, defence and prime minister of Pakistan, all rolled into one

item.title: Bangladesh must break free from Yunus’s chaos, lift Awami League ban and reset ties with India
item.description: After Muhammad Yunus’s self-obsessed regime, until Tarique Rahman welcomes competition and criticism, he will be less the leader of a great nation and more the benefactor of a great fraud

item.title: How Jamaat’s rise on Bangladesh border heightens India’s eastern frontier risks
item.description: The 2026 election has delivered a national partner in Tarique Rahman’s BNP, but it has also entrenched a hardened ideological adversary directly across the border from India’s most sensitive states

item.title: A strategic reset: Japan Inc bets bigger on India amid global uncertainty
item.description: The 2025 Japan Bank of International Cooperation survey ranked India first for the fourth straight year in manufacturing and, for the second consecutive year, in non-manufacturing, with over 60 per cent of respondents backing it

item.title: Social media addiction is real and dangerous
item.description: When a 62-year-old goes into withdrawal over Instagram, it’s time we confronted an uncomfortable truth: Social media is no longer harmless entertainment
